00071 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00072 
00073 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00074 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00075 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00076 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00077 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00078 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00079 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00080 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00081 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00082 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00084 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00085 
00086 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00087 
00088 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00089 
00090 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00091 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00093 
00094 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00095 
00096     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00100 
00101 {
00102     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00103     spl_t flags;
00104 
00105     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00106 
00107     adeos_load_cpuid();
00108 
00109     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00110         {
00111         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00112             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00113         }
00114     else
00115         flags |= 2;
00116 
00117     return flags;
00118 }
00119 
00120 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00121 
00122 {
00123     if (!(flags & 2))
00124         {
00125         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00126 
00127         rthal_cli();
00128 
00129         adeos_load_cpuid();
00130 
00131         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00132             {
00133             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00134             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00135             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00136             }
00137         }
00138 
00139     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00140 }
00141 
00142 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00143 
00144 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00145 
00146 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00147 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00148 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00149 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00150 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00151 
00152 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00154 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00155 
00156 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00157 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00158 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00159 /* Using 2/3 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00160    experimentation that proved to fit on tested PPC platforms with
00161    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00162    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00163    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00164 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 2 / 3)

00205 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00206 
00207     /* Kernel mode side */
00208 
00209 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00210     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00211        and SPE are not available to kernel-based Xenomai threads. */
00212     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00213     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00214 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00215 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00216 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00217 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00218 
00219     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00220     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00221     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00222     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00223 
00224     /* User mode side */
00225     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00226     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00227 
00228     /* Init block */
00229     struct xnthread *self;
00230     int imask;
00231     const char *name;
00232     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00233     void *cookie;
00234 
00235 } xnarchtcb_t;
00236

00248 
00249     atomic_t numaps;    /* # of active user-space mappings. */
00250 
00251     int kmflags;        /* Kernel memory flags (0 if vmalloc()). */
00252 
00253     void *heapbase;     /* Shared heap memory base (possibly unaligned). */
00254 
00255     void *shmbase;      /* Shared memory base (page-aligned). */
00256 
00257 } xnarch_heapcb_t;

00259 static inline void xnarch_init_heapcb (xnarch_heapcb_t *hcb)
00260 
00261 {
00262     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00263     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00264     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00265     hcb->shmbase = NULL;
00266 }

00272 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00273     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00274 }
00275 
00276 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00277     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00278 }
00279 
00280 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00281     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00282 }
00283 
00284 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00285     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00286 }

00288 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00289     return adeos_processor_id();
00290 }

00294     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_ATOMIC);

00307 do { \
00308     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00309     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00310     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \
00311     for (;;) ;                          \
00312 } while(0)

00317 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00318 
00319 {
00320     spl_t s;
00321     splhigh(s);
00322     splexit(!!imask);
00323     return !!s;
00324 }

00328 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00329                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00330                                                    void *cookie),
00331                                    void *cookie)
00332 {
00333     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00334 
00335     if (!err)
00336         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00337 
00338     return err;
00339 }
00340 
00341 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00342 
00343     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00344 }
00345 
00346 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00347 
00348 {
00349     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00350         return -EINVAL;
00351 
00352     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00353 
00354     return 0;
00355 }
00356 
00357 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00358 
00359 {
00360     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00361         return -EINVAL;
00362 
00363     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00364 
00365     return 0;
00366 }
00367

00369     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00370 }
00371 
00372 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00373     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00374 }

00376 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00377 
00378     rthal_pend_linux_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00379 }

00394 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00395 
00396 {
00397 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00398     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00399 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00400     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00401        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00402     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00403 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00404 }
00405 
00406 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00407                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00408     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00409 }
00410 
00411 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00412 
00413 {
00414     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00415 
00416     adeos_load_cpuid();
00417 
00418     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00419        and always inside a critical section. */
00420     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00421     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00422     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00423     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00424 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00425     rootcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_task->thread.fpr[0];
00426 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00427 }
00428 
00429 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00430     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00431 }
00432 
00433 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00434                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00435 {
00436     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00437     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00438     unsigned long flags;
00439 
00440     rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00441 
00442     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00443 
00444     if (inproc && inproc != outproc) /* User-space thread switch? */
00445         {
00446         struct mm_struct *prev = outproc->active_mm;
00447         struct mm_struct *next = inproc->active_mm;
00448 
00449         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00450 
00451         inproc->thread.pgdir = next->pgd;
00452 
00453         if (prev != next)
00454             {
00455             get_mmu_context(next);
00456             set_context(next->context, next->pgd);
00457             }
00458 
00459         if (!inproc->mm)
00460             enter_lazy_tlb(prev,inproc);
00461 
00462         /* The following has been lifted from
00463            arch/ppc/kernel/process.c. */
00464 
00465 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00466         if (outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00467             giveup_fpu(outproc);
00468 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00469         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_VEC)))
00470             giveup_altivec(outproc);
00471 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00472 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00473         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_SPE)))
00474             giveup_spe(outproc);
00475 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00476 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00477 
00478 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00479         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == inproc)
00480             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00481 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00482 
00483 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00484         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == inproc)
00485             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00486 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00487 
00488         _switch(&outproc->thread,&inproc->thread);
00489         }
00490     else
00491         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00492         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00493 
00494     rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00495 }
00496 
00497 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00498                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00499     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00500 }
00501 
00502 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00503     /* Empty */
00504 }
00505 
00506 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00507 
00508 {
00509 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00510 
00511     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00512 
00513     if (task)
00514         {
00515         if (task->thread.regs && (task->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00516             giveup_fpu(task);
00517 
00518         return;
00519         }
00520 
00521     /* Save the fp regs of the kernel thread owning the FPU. */
00522 
00523     rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00524 
00525 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00526 }
00527 
00528 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00529 
00530 {
00531 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00532 
00533     if (tcb->user_task)
00534         /* On PowerpPC, we let the unavailability exception happen for
00535            the incoming user-space task if it happens to use the FPU,
00536            instead of eagerly reloading the fp regs upon switch. */
00537         return;
00538 
00539     /* Restore the fp regs of the incoming kernel thread. */
00540 
00541     rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00542 
00543 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00544 }
00545 
00546 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00547                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00548                                          const char *name)
00549 {
00550     tcb->user_task = current;
00551     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00552     tcb->ksp = 0;
00553     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00554 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00555     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00556 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00557     tcb->entry = NULL;
00558     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00559     tcb->self = thread;
00560     tcb->imask = 0;
00561     tcb->name = name;
00562 }
00563 
00564 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00565 
00566     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00567     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00568     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00569 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00570     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00571 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00572     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00573 }
00574 
00575 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00576 
00577 {
00578     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00579     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00580     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00581     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00582 }
00583 
00584 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00585                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00586                                        void *cookie,
00587                                        int imask,
00588                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00589                                        char *name)
00590 {
00591     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00592 
00593     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00594 
00595     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00596     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00597     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00598     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00599     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00600     ksp[26] = flags & ~MSR_EE; /* msr */
00601 
00602     tcb->entry = entry;
00603     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00604     tcb->self = thread;
00605     tcb->imask = imask;
00606     tcb->name = name;
00607 }
00608 
00609 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00610 
00611 {
00612 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00613     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00614        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00615     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00616     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00617 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00618 }
00619 
00620 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00621 
00622     while (!*flagp)
00623         {
00624         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00625         schedule_timeout(1);
00626         }
00627 }
00628 
00629 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00630 
00631 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00632 
00633     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00634 }
00635 
00636 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00637 
00638 {
00639     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00640                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00641                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00642                                      NULL,
00643                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00644 }
00645 
00646 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00647 
00648 {
00649     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00650                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00651                                      NULL,
00652                                      NULL,
00653                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00654 }
00655 
00656 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00657 
00658 {
00659     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00660     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00661 }
00662 
00663 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00664 
00665 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00666 
00667     return 0;
00668 }
00669 
00670 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00671 
00672     return 0;
00673 }
00674 
00675 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00676 
00677     return 0;
00678 }
00679 
00680 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00681 
00682 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00683 
00684 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00685 
00686 {
00687 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00688     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00689        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00690     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00691 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00692     xnshadow_release_events();
00693     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00694     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00695     schedule_timeout(50);
00696     xnarch_release_ipi();
00697 }
00698 
00699 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00700 
00701 {
00702     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00703 
00704     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00705         {
00706         spl_t s;
00707         splsync(s);
00708         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00709         splexit(s);
00710         return 1;
00711         }
00712 
00713     return 0;
00714 }
00715 
00716 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void) {
00717     
00718     xnshadow_grab_events();
00719 }
00720 
00721 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00722 
00723 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00724 
00725 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00726                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00727                                            const char *name)
00728 {
00729     struct task_struct *task = current;
00730 
00731     tcb->user_task = task;
00732     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00733     tcb->ksp = 0;
00734     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00735 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00736     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00737 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00738     tcb->entry = NULL;
00739     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00740     tcb->self = thread;
00741     tcb->imask = 0;
00742     tcb->name = name;
00743 }
00744 
00745 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00746 
00747 {
00748     unsigned irq;
00749 
00750     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00751         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00752                              handler,
00753                              NULL,
00754                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00755 
00756     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00757        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00758        individually. */
00759 
00760     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00761                          handler,
00762                          NULL,
00763                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00764 }
00765 
00766 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00767 
00768 {
00769     unsigned irq;
00770 
00771     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00772         {
00773         switch (irq)
00774             {
00775 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00776             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00777 
00778                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00779                 continue;
00780 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00781 
00782             default:
00783 
00784                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00785             }
00786         }
00787 
00788     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00789 }
00790 
00791 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00792 
00793 {
00794     unsigned irq;
00795 
00796     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00797         {
00798         switch (irq)
00799             {
00800 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00801             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00802 
00803                 continue;
00804 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00805 
00806             default:
00807 
00808                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00809             }
00810         }
00811 
00812     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00813 }
00814 
00815 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00816 
00817 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00818 
00819 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00820     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00821        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00822        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. Since the
00823        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00824        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */ 
00825     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00826 }
00827 
00828 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00829     rthal_release_timer();
00830 }
00831 
00832 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00833 
00834 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00835 
00836 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00837 
00838 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00839 
00840 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00841 
00842 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00843 
00844 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00845 
00846 {
00847     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00848     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00849     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00850 }
00851 
00852 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00853 
00854 {
00855 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00856     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00857        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00858     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00859 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00860 
00861     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00862 
00863     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00864         return -ENOSYS;
00865 
00866     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00867                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00868                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00869                               NULL,
00870                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00871 
00872     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00873 
00874     return xnshadow_mount();
00875 }
00876 
00877 static inline void xnarch_exit (void) {
00878 
00879     xnshadow_cleanup();
00880     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00881     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00882 }
00883 
00884 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00885 
00886 #ifdef __cplusplus
00887 }
00888 #endif

00894 #define xnarch_delete_display(obj)
00895 #define xnarch_post_graph(obj,state)
00896 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
